intro: Turnera annectens, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Turneraceae and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually ovate or elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
